title: Analysis of function with diff. eq. part - c

content.description:
Let f be a function that is differentiable throughout its domain and that has the following properties.

(i) \(f\left(x+y\right)=\frac{f\left(x\right)+f\left(y\right)}{1-f\left(x\right)f\left(y\right)}\) for all real numbers x, y, and x + y in the domain of f 

(ii) \(\displaystyle \lim_{h\to0}f\left(h\right)=0\)

(iii) \(\displaystyle \lim_{h\to0}\frac{f\left(h\right)}{h}=1\)
content.question: Find f (x) by solving the differential equation in part (b).

frqParts.text: Find f (x) by solving the differential equation in part (b).

topic.text: 6.8: Finding Antiderivatives and Indefinite Integrals - Basic Rules and Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
